issue.title: trilltrill.jp

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

issue.title: cf.emea-free.prd.media.max.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads)
 [http://cf.emea-free.prd.media.max.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcf.emea-free.prd.media.max.com)
### Comment
> cf.emea-free.prd.media.max.com
> akm.emea-free.prd.media.max.com
> gcp.emea-free.prd.media.max.com
> These domain names are used for ad delivery in the Smart TV app of the Max ad-supported version. When the address emea-free.prd.media.max.com is blocked, it removes the ads without affecting any functionality of the application. Information about the ad-supported subscription can be found at: https://help.hbomax.com/tr-en/Answer/Detail/000002520
> 
> 
> 

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/fr81obxrzoooggogkg8cs44ww8ogss4i85g6zrqy6o.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
Browser: | Chrome

comment.body:
Let me try that and get back to you

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for Android.

-------- Original Message --------
On Monday, 11/03/25 at 18:15 Ajstrick81 ***@***.***> wrote:

> ajstrick81 left a comment [(AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters#215201)](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/215201#issuecomment-3483141826)
>
>>>> ***@***.***(https://github.com/ajstrick81) Which blocking helps?
>>>> ***@***.***(https://github.com/jo2dan94) Could you please test?
>>>>
>>>>> cf.amer-free.prd.media.max.com
>>>>> out053a3bejgh7t0phqa0csou.litix.io
>>>
>>> ***@***.***(https://github.com/Alex-302) & ***@***.***(https://github.com/jo2dan94) - I have incorporated the domains that were part of the original post successfully. I haven't tested the new ones that were posted earlier today. These are the custom filter rules I use in my AdGuard Home environment via Onn 4K Plus. I can confirm that there are zero ads and no playback issues with these.
>>> ! --- HBO MAX / MAX APP CUSTOM BLOCKING LIST (AdGuard Home / DNS) --- ! Purpose: Block SSAI ad hosts and tracking CDNs used by the HBO / Max streaming app. ! Date: 2025-10-24 ! 1. PRIMARY REGEX BLOCK: Targets Litix ad/telemetry shards /^([a-z0-9-]+.)?litix.io$/ /^[a-z0-9-]+.litix.io$/ /^out[0-9a-z]+.litix.io$/ ! 2. SECONDARY BLOCK: FreeWheel (SSAI ad server) /^([a-z0-9-]+.)?fwmrm.net$/ /^[0-9a-z-]+.v.fwmrm.net$/ ! 3. SPECIFIC KNOWN HOSTS (from logs and user observations) ||out053a3bejgh7t0phqa0csou.litix.io^ ||2ecd5.v.fwmrm.net^ ||cf.amer-free.prd.media.max.com^$important ||gmss.use2.prd.api.discomax.com^$important ||gcp.amer-free.prd.media.max.com^$important ||abbo7hmaaaaaaaamaaaaaaaaaaaaa.e693b67d00e42.cbr.cloudfront.net^$important ! 4. NOTES ! - Litix.io is a Conviva/advertising analytics endpoint; blocking may disable telemetry. ! - fwmrm.net (FreeWheel) is used for SSAI ads and sometimes player licensing; test playback. ! - The CloudFront and Max.com entries target ad or telemetry delivery used by HBO Max. ! - If the app fails to start or stream, comment out the fwmrm.net and discomax.com lines first.
>>
>> ***@***.***(https://github.com/ajstrick81) I blocked some of the domains u mentioned and I ran into issues on my Roku TV it spins literally for minutes then plays the video. U don't have this issue?
>
> Hey ***@***.***(https://github.com/jo2dan94) , I didn't experience any playback issues either on my Onn 4K Plus or my Android phone. I would maybe try clearing your app cache and force stopping the app? I just encountered the new ad domains that you listed today and will have to add them to my blocklist. Appreciate you pointing those out!
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, [view it on GitHub](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/215201#issuecomment-3483141826), or [unsubscribe](https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/BV34USUL5EJVXHW6KWUKWTL327O2HAVCNFSM6AAAAACIYQRPY6VHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZTIOBTGE2DCOBSGY).
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***>

### Comment
> cf.emea-free.prd.media.max.com
> akm.emea-free.prd.media.max.com
> gcp.emea-free.prd.media.max.com
> These domain names are used for ad delivery in the Smart TV app of the Max ad-supported version. When the address emea-free.prd.media.max.com is blocked, it removes the ads without affecting any functionality of the application. Information about the ad-supported subscription can be found at: https://help.hbomax.com/tr-en/Answer/Detail/000002520

I haven't tested the new ones that were posted earlier today. These are the custom filter rules I use in my AdGuard Home environment via Onn 4K Plus. I can confirm that there are zero ads and no playback issues with these.
> > ! --- HBO MAX / MAX APP CUSTOM BLOCKING LIST (AdGuard Home / DNS) --- ! Purpose: Block SSAI ad hosts and tracking CDNs used by the HBO / Max streaming app. ! Date: 2025-10-24 ! 1. PRIMARY REGEX BLOCK: Targets Litix ad/telemetry shards /^([a-z0-9-]+.)?litix.io$/ /^[a-z0-9-]+.litix.io$/ /^out[0-9a-z]+.litix.io$/ ! 2. SECONDARY BLOCK: FreeWheel (SSAI ad server) /^([a-z0-9-]+.)?fwmrm.net$/ /^[0-9a-z-]+.v.fwmrm.net$/ ! 3. SPECIFIC KNOWN HOSTS (from logs and user observations) ||out053a3bejgh7t0phqa0csou.litix.io^ ||2ecd5.v.fwmrm.net^ ||cf.amer-free.prd.media.max.com^$important ||gmss.use2.prd.api.discomax.com^$important ||gcp.amer-free.prd.media.max.com^$important ||abbo7hmaaaaaaaamaaaaaaaaaaaaa.e693b67d00e42.cbr.cloudfront.net^$important ! 4. NOTES ! - Litix.io is a Conviva/advertising analytics endpoint; blocking may disable telemetry. ! - fwmrm.net (FreeWheel) is used for SSAI ads and sometimes player licensing; test playback. ! - The CloudFront and Max.com entries target ad or telemetry delivery used by HBO Max. ! - If the app fails to start or stream, comment out the fwmrm.net and discomax.com lines first.

Hey @jo2dan94 , I didn't experience any playback issues either on my Onn 4K Plus or my Android phone. I would maybe try clearing your app cache and force stopping the app? I just encountered the new ad domains that you listed today and will have to add them to my blocklist. Appreciate you pointing those out!

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads)
 [http://cf.emea-free.prd.media.max.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcf.emea-free.prd.media.max.com)
### Comment
> cf.emea-free.prd.media.max.com
> akm.emea-free.prd.media.max.com
> gcp.emea-free.prd.media.max.com
> These domain names are used for ad delivery in the Smart TV app of the Max ad-supported version. When the address emea-free.prd.media.max.com is blocked, it removes the ads without affecting any functionality of the application. Information about the ad-supported subscription can be found at: https://help.hbomax.com/tr-en/Answer/Detail/000002520
> 
> 
> 

### Screenshots
<details>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/fr81obxrzoooggogkg8cs44ww8ogss4i85g6zrqy6o.png?nc=1)
</details>

comment.body:
> > > > [@ajstrick81](https://github.com/ajstrick81) Which blocking helps?
> > > > [@jo2dan94](https://github.com/jo2dan94) Could you please test?
> > > > > cf.amer-free.prd.media.max.com
> > > > > out053a3bejgh7t0phqa0csou.litix.io
> > > 
> > > 
> > > [@Alex-302](https://github.com/Alex-302) & [@jo2dan94](https://github.com/jo2dan94) - I have incorporated the domains that were part of the original post successfully. I haven't tested the new ones that were posted earlier today. These are the custom filter rules I use in my AdGuard Home environment via Onn 4K Plus. I can confirm that there are zero ads and no playback issues with these.
> > > ! --- HBO MAX / MAX APP CUSTOM BLOCKING LIST (AdGuard Home / DNS) --- ! Purpose: Block SSAI ad hosts and tracking CDNs used by the HBO / Max streaming app. ! Date: 2025-10-24 ! 1. PRIMARY REGEX BLOCK: Targets Litix ad/telemetry shards /^([a-z0-9-]+.)?litix.io$/ /^[a-z0-9-]+.litix.io$/ /^out[0-9a-z]+.litix.io$/ ! 2. SECONDARY BLOCK: FreeWheel (SSAI ad server) /^([a-z0-9-]+.)?fwmrm.net$/ /^[0-9a-z-]+.v.fwmrm.net$/ ! 3. SPECIFIC KNOWN HOSTS (from logs and user observations) ||out053a3bejgh7t0phqa0csou.litix.io^ ||2ecd5.v.fwmrm.net^ ||cf.amer-free.prd.media.max.com^$important ||gmss.use2.prd.api.discomax.com^$important ||gcp.amer-free.prd.media.max.com^$important ||abbo7hmaaaaaaaamaaaaaaaaaaaaa.e693b67d00e42.cbr.cloudfront.net^$important ! 4. NOTES ! - Litix.io is a Conviva/advertising analytics endpoint; blocking may disable telemetry. ! - fwmrm.net (FreeWheel) is used for SSAI ads and sometimes player licensing; test playback. ! - The CloudFront and Max.com entries target ad or telemetry delivery used by HBO Max. ! - If the app fails to start or stream, comment out the fwmrm.net and discomax.com lines first.
> > 
> > 
> > [@ajstrick81](https://github.com/ajstrick81) I blocked some of the domains u mentioned and I ran into issues on my Roku TV it spins literally for minutes then plays the video. U don't have this issue?
> 
> Hey [@jo2dan94](https://github.com/jo2dan94) , I didn't experience any playback issues either on my Onn 4K Plus or my Android phone. I would maybe try clearing your app cache and force stopping the app? I just encountered the new ad domains that you listed today and will have to add them to my blocklist. Appreciate you pointing those out!

Samsung TV must use a different sdk or something I still get ads at beginning and ads in between. As for the buffering problems it's because none of the h264.io domains can be blocked
